poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: The dogs of Thimphu run the place Their tongues like socks hanging out of drawers (Red socks in a blue wash, tut.) Their pelts stretched out like so many Texas drawls So many: the capital's been carpet-bombed with mutts Mongrel dods of not-quite-there, their dreaming Controls the flight of daws. Good karma: don't imagine It brings you back as a prince, jacuzzi Full of compliant dolls and suchlike froth. No, It daubs you in cheap fur on Thimphu's rustic roads The holy mountain draws you out at dusk Into the ululation.
